February 23, 1992: Fiction
HIDEAWAY, by Dean R. Koontz. (Putnam, $22.95.) A man miraculously
resuscitated after he has technically died is haunted by visions of evil.
RISING SUN, by Michael Crichton. (Knopf, $22.) The mysterious death of a young
woman leads to an investigation in which technology and the American-Japanese
rivalry play major roles.
SCARLETT, by Alexandra Ripley. (Warner, $24.95.) The sequel to "Gone With the
Wind."
DISNEY'S BEAUTY AND THE BEAST. (Gallery Books/Penguin USA, $6.98.) A
retelling of the classic fairy tale in words and pictures.
BYGONES, by LaVyrle Spencer. (Putnam, $21.95.) A dinner party, attended by a
woman, her former husband and their two grown children, reveals family strains
and love.
LINE OF FIRE, by W. E. B. Griffin. (Putnam, $21.95.) The fifth volume of "The
Corps" tells of an attempt to rescue marines during World War II.
FUGITIVE NIGHTS, by Joseph Wambaugh. (Perigord/Morrow, $22.) Three people
on the trail of a dangerous fugitive, through the glamour spots and desert areas of
Palm Springs, Calif.
VOX, by Nicholson Baker. (Random House, $15.) A man and a woman learn
about each other and themselves through a telephone conversation on an "adult
party line."
PRIVATE EYES, by Jonathan Kellerman. (Bantam, $21.50.) The psychologist-
detective Alex Delaware to the rescue of an actress menaced by a man recently
released from prison.
McNALLY'S SECRET, by Lawrence Sanders. (Putnam, $21.95.) The sleuth Archy
McNally's pursuit of a stolen block of priceless stamps uncovers scandals on
Florida's Gold Coast.
NO GREATER LOVE, by Danielle Steel. (Delacorte, $23.) The sinking of the
Titanic greatly alters the life of Edwina Winfield.
NEEDFUL THINGS, by Stephen King. (Viking, $24.95.) A newcomer opens a
shop in Castle Rock, Me., bringing bargains as well as nightmares.
THE SUM OF ALL FEARS, by Tom Clancy. (Putnam, $24.95.) Middle Eastern
terrorists edge the world to the brink of nuclear war.
GUARDIAN ANGEL, by Sara Paretsky. (Delacorte, $20.) The private eye V. I.
Warshawski probes a case involving pet dogs, a man's disappearance and
February 23, 1992
Non-Fiction
REVOLUTION FROM WITHIN, by Gloria Steinem. (Little, Brown, $22.95.) The
reflections of a leading feminist on her own and other people's struggles to
achieve self-esteem.
DEN OF THIEVES, by James B. Stewart. (Simon & Schuster, $25.) How Ivan
Boesky, Michael Milken, Martin Siegel and Dennis Levine plundered and created
havoc on Wall Street.
MEMORIES, by Ralph Emery with Tom Carter. (Macmillan, $19.95.) The
autobiography of a country-music broadcaster.
BACKLASH, by Susan Faludi. (Crown, $24.) A journalist contends that the media
and political groups are staging a war against women's rights.
ME: Stories of My Life, by Katharine Hepburn. (Knopf, $25.) The actress's
memoirs.
PLAUSIBLE DENIAL, by Mark Lane. (Thunder's Mouth/Publishers Group West,
$22.95.) A lawyer's presentation of the case for believing that the C.I.A. was
involved in the death of John F. Kennedy.
THE JORDAN RULES, by Sam Smith. (Simon & Schuster, $22.) A reporter's
account of an N.B.A. championship season spent with Michael Jordan and the
Chicago Bulls.
BROTHER EAGLE, SISTER SKY: A Message From Chief Seattle, illustrated by
Susan Jeffers. (Dial, $14.95.) An environmental warning from the 19th-century
American Indian.
THE WORLD IS MY HOME, by James A. Michener. (Random House, $25.) The
autobiography of the popular novelist.
MOLLY IVINS CAN'T SAY THAT, CAN SHE? by Molly Ivins. (Random House,
$23.) Essays about the current political and cultural scene.
PARLIAMENT OF WHORES, by P. J. O'Rourke. (Entrekin/Atlantic Monthly,
$19.95.) A humorist's attempt to explain the Federal Government.
SEIZE THE MOMENT, by Richard Nixon. (Simon & Schuster, $25.) The former
President defines the challenges America faces in the newly changed world and
what our country should do about them.
UH-OH, by Robert Fulghum. (Villard, $19.) Thoughts on life's commonplaces.
THE TEXAS CONNECTION, by Craig I. Zirbel. (Texas Connection/Ingram,
$21.95.) A Scottsdale, Ariz., attorney argues that Lyndon Johnson was involved in
the assassination of John F. Kennedy.
